body:
If you run `make` twice in the documentation directory without running `make clean` in-between, you see strange warning messages:

```
/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/docs/index.rst:44: WARNING: toctree contains reference to document u'package_list' that doesn't have a title: no link will be generated
/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/docs/index.rst:44: WARNING: toctree contains reference to document u'package_list' that doesn't have a title: no link will be generated
/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/docs/index.rst:44: WARNING: toctree contains reference to document u'package_list' that doesn't have a title: no link will be generated
/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/docs/index.rst:44: WARNING: toctree contains reference to document u'package_list' that doesn't have a title: no link will be generated
/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/docs/index.rst:44: WARNING: toctree contains reference to document u'package_list' that doesn't have a title: no link will be generated
generating indices... genindex/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/docs/index.rst:44: WARNING: toctree contains reference to document u'package_list' that doesn't have a title: no link will be generated
 py-modindex/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/docs/index.rst:44: WARNING: toctree contains reference to document u'package_list' that doesn't have a title: no link will be generated

writing additional pages... search/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/docs/index.rst:44: WARNING: toctree contains reference to document u'package_list' that doesn't have a title: no link will be generated
```

This warning message usually happens when you try to include a file without a title in the toctree, but package_list.rst does have a title, so I have no idea what's going on.
title: Can't make documentation without running make clean first
